model module

class model.NDwTIs(B: ndarray, K: ndarray, w_pos: float, w_neg: float, threshold: float, alpha: float, noise_std: float, external_force=None, x_init: ndarray | None = None, dt: float = 0.01, t_max: float = 1.0)[source]

Bases: object

Node Dynamics with Triadic Interactions.

Parameters:

  • B (numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes, n_edges)) – the boundary operator of the structural network

  • K (numpy.ndarray of shape (n_edges, n_nodes)) – the regulator network (structure of triadic interactions)

  • w_pos (float) – the weight of positive regulator

  • w_neg (float) – the weight of negative regulator

  • threshold (float) – the threshold parameter

  • alpha (float) – the coefficient of the triadic Laplacian

  • noise_std (float) – the standard deviation of the Gaussian noise

  • external_force (function, default = None) – the external force as a function of time

  • x_init (numpy.ndarray, default = None) – the initial states of nodes

  • dt (float, default = 0.01) – the time step size of the evolution

  • t_max (float, default = 1.) – the time duration of the evolution

n_nodes

the number of nodes in the structural network

Type:

int

n_edges

the number of edges in the structural network

Type:

int

n_hyperedges

the number of triadic interactions

Type:

int

n_pos_regulators

the number of positive regulators

Type:

int

n_neg_regulators

the number of negative regulators

Type:

int

n_timesteps

the number of timesteps

Type:

int

derivative(x: ndarray, t: float) → ndarray[source]

The time-derivatives of the states.

Parameters:

  • x (numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes,)) – The states of nodes.

  • t (float) – The time.

Returns:

dxdt – The time-derivatives of the states.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes,)

getLaplacian(x: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Compute the Laplacian of the states.

Parameters:

x (numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes,)) – The states of nodes.

Returns:

L – The Laplacian of the states.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes, n_nodes)

integrate(deterministic: bool = False) → ndarray[source]

Evolve the system.

Parameters:

deterministic (bool, optional (default = False)) – If True, the integration is deterministic. (Default value = False)

Returns:

timeseries – The time series of the states.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes, n_timesteps)

noise(x: ndarray, t: float) → ndarray[source]

The coeficients of the noise term.

Parameters:

  • x (numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes,)) – The states of nodes.

  • t (float) – The time.

Returns:

noise – The coeficients of the noise term.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes, n_nodes)

run(deterministic: bool = False) → ndarray[source]

Run the system.

Parameters:

deterministic (bool, optional (default = False)) – If True, the model runs deterministically. (Default value = False)

Returns:

timeseries – The time series of the states.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray of shape (n_nodes, n_timesteps)
